name: Almeida, Deladier
title: Painter / Visual Artist
notes: Brazilian-born painter based in California since the mid-1980s. Earned his art degree from UC Davis, where he studied under Wayne Thiebaud and Roland Petersen. Represented by Caldwell Snyder Gallery in San Francisco and Blue Rain Gallery in Santa Fe. Known for aerial landscape paintings of California, Colorado, and New Mexico.

name: Aoun, Joseph E.
title: President
ngos: American Council on Education (board and past chair); Boston Private Industry Council; Boston World Partnerships; Jobs for Mass; New England Council; Greater Boston Chamber of Commerce (Executive Committee); Massachusetts Business Roundtable; Massachusetts Math & Science Initiative; Mass Life Sciences Collaborative (Leadership Council); City to City Boston (co-chair); American Academy of Arts and Sciences
notes: 7th president of Northeastern University since 2006. Lebanese-born American linguist with PhD from MIT. Under his leadership, Northeastern expanded to 13 campuses across North America and the UK. Author of Robot-Proof: Higher Education in the Age of Artificial Intelligence (MIT Press). Fellow of the American Association for the Advancement of Science.

name: Boggan, James E.
title: Emeritus Julian R. Youmans Endowed Chair and Professor of Neurological Surgery
notes: Neurosurgeon born in Chicago in 1949. Graduated from University of Chicago Pritzker School of Medicine in 1976. Completed neurosurgical residency at UCSF in 1982. Joined UC Davis faculty in 1985; promoted to Professor in 1993. Appointed Julian R. Youmans Professor and Endowed Chair in Neurological Surgery in 2013. Recognized in Castle Connolly's America's Top Doctors.

name: Caplan, Thomas M.
title: Novelist
ngos: PEN/Faulkner Foundation (founder, former chairman, board member emeritus)
notes: Novelist and longtime close friend of President Bill Clinton; the two met as Georgetown freshmen in 1964. Georgetown School of Foreign Service graduate; MBA from Harvard. Author of four novels: The Spy Who Jumped Off the Screen, Line of Chance, Parallelogram, and Grace and Favor. Son of Marvin Caplan, the Baltimore jeweler to the Kennedy family. Lives on the Eastern Shore of Maryland.

name: Chang, James
title: Johnson and Johnson Professor of Surgery; former Chief, Division of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery
notes: Hand and upper extremity surgeon. BA/BS from Stanford in Biology and Economics; MD from Yale (Alpha Omega Alpha, Cum Laude). Served as Division Chief of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery at Stanford from 2006 until recently stepping down after over 20 years. Elected to the American Surgical Association in 2010. Past president of the American Society for Surgery of the Hand (2017-18).

name: DeGrado, William F.
title: Toby Herfindal Presidential Professor of Entrepreneurship and Innovation, Department of Pharmaceutical Chemistry
notes: Pioneer of de novo protein design who coined the term. Elected to National Academy of Sciences (1999), American Academy of Arts and Sciences (1998), and National Academy of Inventors (2014). Career began at DuPont (1981-1996), then University of Pennsylvania (1996-2011), then UCSF. Scientific co-founder of Pliant Therapeutics and founder of PolyMedix. Member of UCSF Cardiovascular Research Institute.

name: Ferguson, Thomas Francis
employer: University of Massachusetts Boston; Institute for New Economic Thinking
title: Professor Emeritus of Political Science; Research Director
notes: Political scientist and author born 1949. PhD from Princeton. Former faculty at MIT and University of Texas Austin. Best known for his Investment Theory of Party Competition, detailed in his 1995 book Golden Rule. Contributing editor at The Nation. Member of editorial board of the International Journal of Political Economy. Research focuses on money in politics and campaign finance.

name: Grafton, Scott Thomas
title: Distinguished Professor of Psychological and Brain Sciences; Director, Brain Imaging Center; Bedrosian-Coyne Presidential Chair in Neuroscience
notes: Neuroscientist specializing in the neural basis of goal-directed behavior and motor learning. BA in Mathematics and Psychobiology from UC Santa Cruz; MD from USC. Completed neurology residency at University of Washington and nuclear medicine residency at UCLA. Joined UCSB faculty in 2006. Co-Director at the Institute for Collaborative Biotechnologies (DoD-funded). Author of Physical Intelligence (2020). Over 230 peer-reviewed publications.

name: Green, Jeffrey T.
title: Founder, Chairman, and CEO
ngos: Jeff T. Green Family Foundation (founder); CEO Action for Diversity and Inclusion (signatory)
notes: Born March 15, 1977. BA from Brigham Young University; BA from University of Southern California. Founded AdECN (world's first online advertising exchange), sold to Microsoft in 2007. Co-founded The Trade Desk in 2009; took it public on Nasdaq in September 2016. Forbes estimated net worth at $6 billion (2023). Signed The Giving Pledge in 2021. Donated $600,000 to Equality Utah, an LGBTQ rights organization. Lives in Newbury Park, California.

name: Griffin, Noah Webster
title: President and Founder, The Cole Porter Society
ngos: Golden Gate Opera (board); Cole Porter Society (founder and president); Fair Housing of Marin; Bread and Roses; Legal Aid of Marin; California Mentor Foundation
notes: Born January 31, 1946 in San Francisco. Harvard Law School graduate; Fisk University; Yale history fellow and Coro Public Affairs fellow. Former Press Secretary to San Francisco Mayor Frank Jordan; Legislative aide to Dianne Feinstein; Statewide Deputy Campaign Director for President Clinton; Public Affairs Director for Charles Schwab. Founded the Cole Porter Society in 2014. Co-wrote the official ballad of the Golden Gate Bridge. Singer-songwriter and newspaper columnist. Ran for Marin County Supervisor (2004). Lives in Tiburon, California.

name: Hampson, Dirk
title: Director of Winemaking Emeritus; Co-owner
notes: Oregon-raised winemaker who joined Far Niente in 1982. Trained at Schloss Vollrads in Germany, Labour√©-Roi in Burgundy, and was the first American winemaking apprentice at Chateau Mouton-Rothschild in Bordeaux. Co-founded Nickel and Nickel winery in 1997 with Gil Nickel and Larry Maguire. Created the Dolce dessert wine. Retains status as director of winemaking emeritus and partner-owner of Far Niente Wine Estates.

name: Maze, George S.
notes: Possibly George Sim Maze, a California-licensed attorney. A George Maze Jr. is documented as a Bay Area attorney and past president of the Northern California Tennis Association. Insufficient confirmed information to attribute to this specific individual.

name: McNutt, Scott H.
title: Insolvency Consultant (formerly Principal, McNutt Law Group LLP)
notes: San Francisco-based bankruptcy and insolvency attorney. Founded McNutt Law Group LLP in 1999; closed the firm in 2018 after over 20 years. Served on the Board of Governors of the State Bar of California and chaired its Insolvency Law Committee. Former adjunct Professor of Law at UC Davis. Counsel to the Fee Examiner in the PG&E Bankruptcy Proceedings. Now provides insolvency consulting to corporate boards.

name: Moore, James Elliott II
employer: University of Southern California (Emeritus); Reason Foundation
title: Professor Emeritus, Viterbi School of Engineering and Sol Price School of Public Policy; Senior Fellow
notes: Transportation engineer and public policy academic. MS and PhD in Civil Engineering from Stanford. Joined USC in 1988; retired in 2022 after 36 years as Professor Emeritus. Chaired the Epstein Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering 2004-2010. Past president of the Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers (2015-16). Research focused on transportation networks, infrastructure risk management, and earthquake resilience.

name: Nevolo, Gary J.
title: Counsel
notes: San Francisco attorney specializing in products liability, toxic tort, commercial, and environmental litigation. Undergraduate degree from Santa Clara University; J.D. from Golden Gate University School of Law. Previously at Sheppard Mullin Richter and Hampton LLP and operated his own law offices. State Bar of California licensed since approximately 1972.

name: Oakley, John B.
employer: University of California, Davis School of Law
title: Distinguished Professor of Law Emeritus
notes: Law professor at UC Davis from 1975 to 2009. BA from UC Berkeley; JD from Yale. Appointed by Chief Justice Rehnquist as Reporter for the U.S. Judicial Conference Committee on Federal-State Jurisdiction. Reporter for the American Law Institute's Federal Judicial Code Revision Project (1995-2004). Served as Chair of the UC Academic Council and faculty representative to the Regents (2006-07). Recipient of the 2012 Oliver Johnson Award for Distinguished Service to the UC Academic Senate.

name: Papadopoulos, Panos
title: Byron and Elvira Nishkian Chair in Structural Engineering; Professor, Department of Mechanical Engineering; Director, Aerospace Engineering Programs
notes: Greek-born structural and computational mechanics engineer. Undergraduate diploma in Civil Engineering from Aristotle University, Greece; MS and PhD in Civil Engineering from UC Berkeley. Faculty member at UC Berkeley since 1992. Director of the Computational Solid Mechanics Laboratory. Research areas include continuum mechanics, contact mechanics, and computational plasticity.

name: Patterson, David A.
title: Distinguished Engineer (Google); Pardee Professor of Computer Science, Emeritus (UC Berkeley); Vice Chair, RISC-V International Board
ngos: Computing Research Association (former board chair); RISC-V International (board vice chair)
notes: Pioneer of computer architecture. Born November 16, 1947. Professor at UC Berkeley from 1976 to 2016. Co-winner (with John Hennessy) of the 2017 ACM A.M. Turing Award for developing RISC architecture. Coined the term RISC and led the Berkeley RISC project; also led research on RAID storage. ACM President 2004-2006. Fellow of ACM, IEEE, and AAAS. Elected to National Academy of Engineering and National Academy of Sciences.

name: Reiss, Mitchell
title: Former President and CEO, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation; Former President, Washington College; Former U.S. Special Envoy for Northern Ireland
ngos: Carnegie Council for Ethics in International Affairs; Wilson Center
notes: Born June 12, 1957. BA from Williams College; MA from Fletcher School (Tufts); JD from Columbia Law School; DPhil from Oxford (St. Antony's College). White House Fellow at the National Security Council under Scowcroft and Colin Powell. Director of Policy Planning, U.S. State Department (2003-2005) under Colin Powell. U.S. Special Envoy for Northern Ireland with Ambassador rank (2003-2007). Chief negotiator at Korean Peninsula Energy Development Organization (KEDO, 1995-1999). 27th President of Washington College (2010-2014). 8th President and CEO of The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation (2014-2019). National Security Adviser to Mitt Romney's 2008 and 2012 presidential campaigns. Author of Negotiating with Evil (2010) and Bridled Ambition (1995).

name: Rine, Jasper
title: Howard Hughes Medical Institute Professor; Professor of the Graduate School, Division of Genetics, Genomics, Evolution and Development
ngos: Embark Veterinary (Scientific Advisory Board); Genetics Society of America (past president)
notes: Born 1953. Geneticist and molecular biologist at UC Berkeley since 1982. Member of the National Academy of Sciences, American Academy of Arts and Sciences, and Fellow of the American Academy of Microbiology. Elected to the National Academy of Inventors. Director of the LBNL Human Genome Center (2001-2004). Research specializes in epigenetics, yeast genetics, and dog genetics. Co-founder of Debut Biotechnology and other biotech companies.

name: Ryan, Timothy P.
title: Head of Technology and Business Enablement; Member, Executive Management Team
ngos: CEO Action for Diversity and Inclusion (co-founder); Conference Board (member); World Economic Forum (participant)
notes: Former US Chairman and Senior Partner of PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), overseeing strategy and 75,000 US employees. Joined Citigroup in June 2024 as Head of Technology and Business Enablement. Over 30 years in financial services. CPA licensed in Massachusetts and New York. Graduate of Babson College. Co-founded CEO Action for Diversity and Inclusion, the largest CEO-driven business commitment to advance DEI, with over 2,400 signatory organizations.
